posts.title: Entrepreneurship with women
posts.description: Learn about the context and importance of female entrepreneurship in the country, as well as tips for entrepreneurship.

pill.title: CONTENTS
pill.content:
1. Tips for entrepreneurship.
    2. Gender and entrepreneurship.
    3. Female entrepreneurship in Colombia.
    4. Female entrepreneurship in Casanare.

pill.title: INTRODUCTION
pill.content:
Welcome:


In Latin America, many organizations promote women's entrepreneurship, especially women from disadvantaged groups, whose objective is income generation, poverty reduction and women's empowerment. However, in Colombia and other countries in the region there is still a long way to go to achieve equity. A study conducted by MasterCard and Endeavor, between 2010 and 2020, highlights that at least 84% of women surveyed agree to some degree that they face more difficulties than men in the process of entrepreneurship, 40% of them have been victims of some kind of discrimination and 97% of the cases are due to gender issues.

 

In this lesson you will learn tips for entrepreneurship, entrepreneurship from a gender point of view, the importance of female entrepreneurship and success stories from the region.

pill.title: Tips for entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Discover your skills. 


Not everyone has what it takes to start a business, that does not mean that your idea is not brilliant, just that you may not have some vital personality traits to launch your business. Before investing time or resources, evaluate yourself and see if you have the typical skills of an entrepreneur.


Develop an idea.


Don't start a business just because something is trendy or because you think marketing it will make you money. Develop a business concept that you are passionate about related to something you have some experience in. Then come up with a product or service that you think will improve people's lives.


Test your credibility. 


Once you have an idea figure out how you can turn it into reality. Is the product something people want or need? Can you make a profit selling it? Does it work?


Write a business plan.


A solid business plan will guide you forward. You'll also need it to present your idea to potential investors. It should include a mission statement, an executive summary, a company overview, samples of the service or product, a description of your target market, financial projections and the cost of operations.


Identify your market.


Even if you have detected some interest in your business, you need to do more homework. Assess the market so you can sell to the people who are sure to make the purchase. Make a competitive assessment.


Determine costs. 


Do additional research and know the standard costs within the industry. This will not only help you manage the business more efficiently, it will also be valuable information for investors.


Establish a budget. 


Once you determine how much money you will have to work with, find out how much you need to develop your product or service and create a marketing plan.

pill.title: Tips for entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Find the right investors. 


You're going to need some kind of funding when you start, whether it's from your savings, credit cards, loans, venture capitalists or grants. Find an investor who shares your passion, someone you think you can work with.


Listen to investors. 


Like it or not, they will have an opinion when it comes to your business. Listen to their advice and suggestions, but that doesn't mean you have to do everything they say.


Have a great support system. 


You're going to invest a lot of time and resources into your new business venture. Make sure your family is on board. They should be aware that this process will challenge them financially and emotionally.


Determine the legal structure. 


Determine what works best for you: sole proprietorship, partnership, limited liability company, S corporation, nonprofit organization or cooperative.


Select a name for your business.


Decide on a name that fits your brand, then see if it is available and if you can use it freely in your country and state.


Register your business name. 


If the name you want is available, register it as soon as possible in the corresponding offices.


Take advantage of free resources. These can be social networks or even a person who can offer you advice and experience to move your startup forward.


Fix the accounting books.


Keep track of all the money coming in and going out of the business.

pill.title: Tips for entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Choose the right location.


Choose a location that suits your business needs, one that offers an opportunity for growth, the right level of competition and proximity to suppliers. It should also be accessible to customers.


Don't worry about an office.


If you're not making a profit, don't be mortified about acquiring a space to work, you can do it from home.


Be flexible.


Chances are your original idea will have to be modified. Being able to adapt and change something to give the client something they want will determine whether or not you will be successful.


Share your ideas with friends and family.


The people closest to you are the ones who will be most honest with you about your idea. Don't hesitate to seek their advice and suggestions.


Ignore the negative ones. 


There is a big difference between constructive criticism and someone quickly saying that your business will fail. The best thing you can do is ignore these people.


Don't get angry.


If your idea is rejected by customers or investors don't succumb to anger. Find out what they didn't like, make adjustments and get back to them once you've changed what they wanted.


Deliver the product or service quickly.


Your business is a work in progress and if you launch a product or service quickly, you'll be able to build a community of customers who can provide you with valuable feedback that will help you improve your offering. As the founder of LinkedIn says, "If you're not embarrassed by your first product launch you released it too late."

pill.title: Tips for entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Offer new products or services. 


If you already have customers be sure to take care of them by giving them new products or services.


Be patient.


Always keep in mind that success will not happen overnight. It's going to take some time before you earn anything.


Deliver more than they ask for in the beginning.


 Once you have a new client make sure you go above and beyond for at least the first month. You'll have that customer hooked.


Post on your social networks. 


Don't shy away from sharing your triumphs and struggles. Customers will enjoy your honesty.


Avoid fights with partners.


If you have disagreements, settle the issues as soon as possible. Fights can distract you from doing things right in the business.


Prepare for meetings. 


When preparing for a client meeting, read everything you can about the industry, your competition and the client's company.


Make a meeting agenda. 


Have the objectives you want to touch on handy. Mail that agenda to your colleagues before you meet so they can prepare as well. Make sure these objectives are clear and understood by everyone.


Don't be afraid of the competition. 


Don't badmouth the competition when you are with clients or investors. There is no need to be the object of pity. In fact, talking this way may cause customers to leave with competitors who offer a product or service that you do not. Remember, when the competition leaves, there will be a market for your business. Use that knowledge as inspiration to do things better than your rival.


Benefit from word of mouth.


Nothing beats good word-of-mouth marketing. Let your friends, family and influencers spread the word about what your product or service does.

pill.title: Tips for entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Offer a customer experience. 


An experience includes sensory marketing. This means handling colors, lights, aromas, etcetera. Integrate all these sensations to your offer, in such a way that they conquer the senses of your consumers.


Network.


Don't be afraid to go out and show your face to the public, whether at a conference or just hanging out with a friend on a Friday night.

 

Give impeccable customer service. 


Interacting with people is an important part of your job. Your business could gain new customers because you made them feel important. For example, Zappos wasn't the first online store to sell shoes, but the company perfected its customer service and won many shoppers.


Make sure your Web site works.


Potential customers want to know as much as possible about your business, so access to it should be quick.


Don't worry too much about your finances. 


Some of the best businesses were launched when the economic situation was not the best in the world, so don't overthink it and go for it!


Make sure customers pay the bills. 


Make sure you get paid for your product or service. Instead of being taken advantage of, set a time limit for payment. It also won't hurt to accept credit cards or have the option for them to pay directly on your Web site.


Find the right employees. 


Hire the right people for the job. Even though it's your business, you won't be able to handle everything, so you need qualified people to complete the job.

pill.title: Tips for entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Assign responsibilities. 


Delegate achievable tasks to your work team.


Honesty is the best policy. 


If you have problems with an employee, make sure they are resolved. No one likes to be talked about behind their back.


Don't expect success right away. 


Just because your business hasn't made you a millionaire (yet) doesn't mean your business is a failure. If you've received some kind of profit doing something you're passionate about, it's a success story, isn't it?


Accept when it's time to retire.


Failure is inevitable. If things aren't working out and you've done everything you can, put aside your pride and close down. Something like this is not easy to accept, but it's for the best.


Don't rely solely on the advice of others.


 Although I offer to give you this advice, perhaps the most important is something I learned the hard way: Even though many people offer you their help, realize that in the end you are the owner of the business and the one responsible for its success or failure. If you know what worked, you will have the skills and knowledge to move your business forward.

pill.title: Gender and entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Gender influences the opportunities people have in life from birth. Biological differences are important when boys and girls reach puberty, but social roles are assigned from birth. All societies assign different roles, attributes, and opportunities based on sex: boys and girls are socialized to play the roles expected of women and men in their society, based on each society's ideas about how they should or should not behave.


Sex refers to the biological differences between men and women, which are universal and do not change. For example, only women can give birth and only men grow beards. Gender refers to the social differences and relationships between girls and boys, women and men, which have been learned and vary widely within and between cultures. 


They also change over time and from one generation to the next. For example, in many countries women care for young children, but increasingly men do so; in some countries women do not work in construction, while in others it is common to see them in this sector. Other variables such as age, social class, ethnicity and disability, and the geographic, economic and political environment influence social differences. 


Gender roles are reinforced by the values, norms and stereotypes of each society. However, they can and do change. In fact, practices often change faster than people's ideas about how girls and boys, women and men, should behave. For example, in many societies, girls and women are assumed to be the "weaker sex" and should be protected from heavy workloads. However, poor girls and women often perform heavy work for long hours alongside boys and men. 


Gender equality, or equality between men and women, refers to equal rights, responsibilities, opportunities, treatment and valuation of men and women: 

 

    - In jobs and in companies.
    - In domestic work and family care. 


To look at the business life cycle with a "gender lens" is to ensure that men and women have equal opportunities to succeed in life and in business. 


All people should be treated with dignity and allowed to develop their full potential to ensure a higher quality of life. It does not mean that men and women must be exactly the same: they can be and indeed are different, but they should have equal rights, responsibilities and opportunities and be treated and valued fairly. This applies to the business world as well. Gender equality includes: 


    - Equal human and labor rights.
    - Equal value and fair distribution of: responsibilities and opportunities, workload, decision-making and income.

pill.title: Gender and entrepreneurship.
pill.content:
Gender promotion leads to a higher quality of life for all people. 


Empowering women and girls to participate more in development means working towards more balanced and equitable power relations between the sexes. Sometimes there is fear that progress for women means taking something away from men. However, promoting gender equality does not mean giving more power to women by taking it away from men. It is empowerment for all people: it enables both men and women to participate fully in economic and social life, and leads to a win-win situation for both sexes.  


Achieving gender equality is not a "women's issue" but the responsibility of society as a whole. 


In the past, most of those who advocated gender equality were women. Therefore, it has sometimes been thought that this issue only concerns women and not men; but this idea is disappearing. There is a growing consensus that gender equality is a matter for men and women, that it is the responsibility of society as a whole, and that it requires the contributions and inputs of both men and women. 
The promotion of gender equality must be integrated into business development programs at all stages of their cycle: during design,

 

implementation, monitoring and evaluation. 


It is necessary to conduct a gender analysis and address inequalities between men and women. It will also be necessary to assess and measure that the effects and impacts of development programs benefit and impact both men and women.


Women entrepreneurs and their context.

Not everyone is a natural-born entrepreneur. Especially for women, entering into an entrepreneurial project is a consequence of necessity and not of free choice. To discover personal entrepreneurial characteristics is to see oneself in the present, to form ideas about the future and to set a long-term goal for one's life. 


In many societies and economic situations, people, and especially low-income women, do not have many opportunities to assess their own situation, realize their own strengths and overcome their weaknesses when facing the entrepreneurial world. 


Around the world, women are generally engaged in very small businesses, and it is difficult for many women entrepreneurs to grow them. Women are often unaware of their unequal representation in the business world. In addition to their entrepreneurial activities, they have many family and domestic responsibilities. They often face pressures to share the benefits of the business at home, with the extended family and with the community.

pill.title: Female entrepreneurship in Colombia.
pill.content:
Through entrepreneurship, women contribute to the competitiveness and well-being of the country and their environments. Colombia, which is no stranger to this reality, has been taking important steps.

 

According to the World Economic Forum ranking (2019), the country went from 40th to 22nd place in closing gaps. The Inter-American Development Bank, in 2020, ranked the Colombian entrepreneurial ecosystem third in Latin America as a favorable context for women entrepreneurs. In addition, the World Bank study Women Business and the Law 2020 reflects that the Colombian legal and fiscal environment is favorable for women. These are important advances, but challenges remain.

 

The Government's commitment to closing gender gaps is part of the Public Policy on Entrepreneurship, formed by the Conpes and the Entrepreneurship Law, which seeks to encourage, develop and strengthen entrepreneurships led or formed mostly by women.

 

One of the most important aspects of the Law is the merger of the promotion of entrepreneurship with the search for equity for women through the 'Fondo Mujer Emprende', led by the Vice-Presidency of the Republic, the Council for Women's Equity and iNNpulsa. The Fund seeks to promote, finance and support entrepreneurship, formalization and business strengthening of women in rural and urban areas and already has a program underway, the first of a portfolio of initiatives to come in the future.

pill.title: Female entrepreneurship in Colombia.
pill.content:
This is Núcleo E Mujer, which includes a methodology for strengthening women's entrepreneurship and their economic empowerment. In its first phase, it will prioritize initiatives in sectors such as avocado, cocoa, coffee, panela, livestock and handicrafts -in the case of rural women-, and fashion, tourism, software and processed foods, among others -for urban women-.

 

In addition, the new legislation, which is currently in the process of approving regulatory decrees, includes new tie-breaker criteria in favor of companies led by women in public procurement processes.

 

Linked to the benefits brought by the Entrepreneurship Law are the initiatives that iNNpulsa has developed. For example, to mitigate the barrier of access to financing, in 2020 we designed together with Bancóldex the Mujer Empresaria credit line that has delivered more than 2,300 million in credits to women with micro and small businesses, in 20 departments of the country.

 

In addition, Empodera, which in the 2020 version linked 114 companies of which 85% are led by women and the remaining 15% have female participation in their management team, which indicates that the female entrepreneurial potential of the country is powerful and that betting on its development and strengthening is vital to continue building an Entrepreneurial Nation.

pill.title: Female entrepreneurship in Casanare
pill.content:
The Fe en Colombia program generates spaces for the empowerment of community leaders in an articulated work with state institutions; managing spaces that dynamize the economy of the region and encouraging productive projects. 


An example of this is the work that this program has advanced with two entrepreneurial women, Samanta Supanteve and Paula Hernández, from the department of Casanare, and creators of 'Vita-Copaiba Ancestral' oil, a product that was recognized as innovative by the University of San Gil, Yopal, at the Entrepreneurship Fair held by that educational institution and in which these businesswomen participated.


It is important to highlight that this team of young women developed a 100 percent natural product from the Copaiba tree, which has great benefits such as: eliminating scars and reducing wrinkles.

question.question: Some of the tips for entrepreneurship are:

pill.title: Curiosities
pill.content:
Did you know...


Estée Lauder, the founder of the company that bears her name, was a visionary and a role model. This woman, ahead of her time in every way, created and ran one of the most prestigious and innovative companies in the world, as well as being a wife and mother. 


She started a small business with four skin care products developed by her uncle. She began selling skin care and makeup products in beauty salons, demonstrating her products to women as they sat under hair dryers, and in 1946 officially launched the company, which today is one of the world's leading luxury beauty brands.

posts.title: Entrepreneurship in tourism and gastronomy
posts.description: This Capsule explains the context of tourism and gastronomy in Colombia, the megatrends in these sectors and success stories in Casanare.

pill.title: Content
pill.content:
1. Entrepreneurship in the Colombian tourism sector.
2. Mega tendencies in tourism and business opportunities. 
3. Success stories in Casanare
    3.1. Safari llanero 
    3.2. Tourism MECA 
4. Gastronomic entrepreneurship in Colombia. 
5. Mega trends in gastronomy and business opportunities. 
6. Success stories in Casanare 
    6.1. Llaneridad gourmet
    6.2. Freedom Route Corporation 
    6.3. Orinoquía flavor and art

pill.title: Introduction
pill.content:
Tourism and gastronomy are social, cultural and economic phenomena. These two concepts have been increasingly related to the growth of gastronomic tourism and consumers who are becoming more and more gastronomic connoisseurs. 

 

In this lesson we will look at tips for successful tourism and gastronomic ventures, as well as trends in these sectors and success stories in the region.

pill.title: Entrepreneurship in the Colombian tourism sector
pill.content:
Colombia is a diverse country with a privileged location, which not only attracts domestic and foreign tourists, but also large hotel chains.

 

To maximize these advantages, the sector faces the challenge of developing more and better infrastructure, training its key personnel and strengthening itself in digital terms to serve a growing number of users who prefer these channels.

 

Some important figures to keep in mind about the tourism sector in the country are: 

 

  • Tourism reaches 3.8% of GDP (gross domestic product) in the country.
  • In countries where the tourism sector is more developed, tourism represents about 10% of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP).
  • In 2018, 4'388,815 tourists arrived in the country, 8% more than in 2017. This indicator has increased between 10% and 12% annually, according to Cotelco (Hotel and Tourism Association of Colombia).
  • Bogota, Cartagena, Medellin, Cali, Barranquilla and Bucaramanga are the cities preferred by tourists. The last two cities that did not appear before in these balances have gradually gained prominence.
  • The main reason for tourists to travel was leisure with 44.6%, followed by business with 43.1% and conventions with 6.8%, according to data from the Ministry of Commerce, Industry and Tourism (Mincit).
  • 85% of the country's hotels are micro and small companies.
  • The tax advantages granted to the construction of hotels promoted an investment of more than $5.7 billion and the real income of hotels in the country increased 8.6% compared to 2017, according to the Mincit.

pill.title: Entrepreneurship in the Colombian tourism sector
pill.content:
Opportunities and challenges for SMEs in the tourism sector.

 

The Colombian tourism sector is, above all, a favorable scenario for the growth of small and medium-sized enterprises, although it is necessary to face challenges in order to achieve success. Some of these are:

 

  • Working in a chain: From his experience, Diego Jaramillo, general manager of the Karisma hotel chain for Latin America, states that it is necessary to join forces with airlines, tour operators and hotels to generate a more attractive offer of tourism products in the region.
  • Strengthen the value offer: Gustavo Toro Velásquez, national executive president of Cotelco, refers to the issue of informality, i.e. the offering of lodging services without complying with legal requirements. "This issue generates unfair competition against traditional hotels because these companies do not have the tax or operational burden of hotels".

 

To combat this phenomenon, it is key that formal accommodations reinforce their value offer and communicate it effectively through suitable digital platforms.

 

Considering that many of their managers are empirical, it is necessary that they join the dynamics of the industry that is advancing faster in areas such as technology, innovation, market analysis, among others.

 

  • Expand markets and destinations: Paula Cortés Calle, president of the Colombian Association of Travel and Tourism Agencies (Anato), explains that improving infrastructure in areas of the country where it was not previously viable to have access is a pending task, as well as the search for more and better agreements that favor international connectivity so that, in this way, the showcase of tourism options offered by Colombia and its travel agencies can grow and thus reach new markets with competitive offers.
  • Strengthening suppliers: In the tourism industry, SMEs are not only on the side of hoteliers and agencies, but also of product and service suppliers. Diego Jaramillo, as a representative of an international chain, states that one shortcoming he finds in the country is the lack of suppliers that can meet the demand in regional terms. Meeting this need represents an opportunity for SMEs that could be inserted in this economy of scale and bet on international expansion. The executive emphasizes that Colombian suppliers are structured and sophisticated, qualities that should not be wasted.

pill.title: Mega trends in tourism and business opportunities
pill.content:
During 2020 and 2021, the word travel took on a different meaning. Previously, the doubts when planning a vacation arose from whether you should choose a beach or a mountain, a hostel or a luxury hotel, a car or a plane. Today, these variables are still important. However, they have a new 'adventure partner': the restrictions brought about by the pandemic.

 

Consequently, new ways have emerged to make the most of summer, the days off from Christmas, Easter and any gap in the schedule that means getaway.

 

2022 and the new ways to travel.

 

Undoubtedly, sustainable tourism is here to stay and sustainability has become the key word of recent times. Not only in terms of travel, but also in the new ways in which human beings are looking at life.

 

Being a sustainable tourist means being concerned and caring about the protection of the tourist sites visited, the respect for the host communities and the cultural and natural heritage of the destination.

 

The plan is to be conscious.

 

The year 2022 promises to make conscious travel fashionable, which means that adventurers will choose to travel long distances in order to travel without haste and for extended periods, trying to avoid pollution, making use of alternative transport and thus mitigate carbon emissions.

 

Education and vacations. 

 

The new term "Ed-ventures" is being taken into account by parents as an educational leisure alternative for their children. It is also on the radar of the famous digital nomads, who are fans of the work, travel and technology trinomial.

 

Nature.

 

Contact with nature relieves stress, relaxes, reconnects and recharges. It will always be a good plan to get away from the hustle and bustle of the cities and, in these times, to beware of possible virus contagions.

pill.title: Mega trends in tourism and business opportunities
pill.content:
Slow and steady

 

Slower, unhurried travel is what is now known as slow travel. The priority of this type of tourism is the enjoyment of the experience rather than the destination. Its admirers shy away from the masses, that is, from crowded places. They enjoy the spontaneous, close and natural, and to establish relationships with the locals and their traditions. 

 

Tourism trends in 2021.

 

Domestic tourism.

 

National or domestic travel is the trend in destinations. National tourism, also called local or domestic tourism, involves the traveler's mobilization within the borders of his own country and will be increasingly local according to the proximity of the destination to the place of origin. This type of tourism does not require additional documentation, since it is the same country, and does not represent any barrier with respect to language or currency used.

 

Family tourism.

 

Family tourism, as its name indicates, is that in which the family group is mobilized, totally or partially, that is to say, two or more members of the family can travel. The purpose of this type of tourism is to strengthen family ties through the tourist experience, so its definition is framed within particular limits and requirements. For example, it requires hotel infrastructure capable of accommodating a complete family group, as well as recreational activities that entertain each and every one of its members. Likewise, destinations must have the necessary technology and resources to facilitate the mobilization and stay of a large number of people, since the trip must be a reason for relaxation for the family and not for added stress.

 

Business and event tourism.

 

As globalization and technology advance, business tourism, also known as MICE (Meetings, Incentives, Conventions and Exhibitions) tourism, is gaining ground within the tourism sector. By definition, the individual who does business tourism travels for the need to fulfill work and professional matters such as conventions, events, congresses or exhibitions. The changes in business tourism and events due to the pandemic have generated new relationships and forms of organization such as hybrid and online events, although face-to-face events will return.

pill.title: Mega trends in tourism and business opportunities
pill.content:
Urban tourism.

 

This category includes trips to the world's large cities and urban centers. In general, this is one of the most popular types of tourism chosen by travelers due to its great development and the amenities it offers. These include: large airports with direct flights to any part of the world, extensive hotel infrastructure (adapted to all needs) and a wide range of restaurants and leisure activities. Urban tourism includes business relations, educational tourism and cultural tourism, since cities offer a wide range of leisure and entertainment activities.

 

Rural tourism.

 

Rural tourism, also known as community-based tourism, has recently emerged as an alternative to conventional urban tourism. In this type of tourism, tourists travel to small communities, usually rural, in order to learn about their lifestyle and culture or, in some cases, to disconnect from the city.

 

Nature tourism.

 

These trips are made in the context of nature, relaxation and enjoyment of the environment, in addition to the practice of activities related to the area. Within this framework, there is a varied offer of activities for 5.0 travelers. Its activity is quite diversified and revolves around contact with nature and its preservation, so it is deeply linked to sustainable tourism.

 

Similarly, nature tourism has laid the foundations for the development of other types of tourism, among which are:

 

  • Agro-tourism, where tourists have the opportunity to visit vineyards, farms and other food production and processing plants.
  • Ecotourism, where tourists visit preserved areas such as national parks or reserves. This type of tourism promotes stays with a lower environmental impact and activities aimed at protecting natural areas.
  • Wild tourism, where the main attraction is to be in contact with animals in their natural habitat.
  • Adventure tourism, which by definition includes physical activities such as mountaineering, hiking, climbing, among others.

pill.title: Mega trends in tourism and business opportunities
pill.content:
Medical tourism.

 

Also known as health tourism, medical tourism is that in which the tourist travels with the purpose of having a medical consultation or undergoing a surgical procedure to which he/she does not have access in his/her place of origin. Within this group, cosmetic surgery is one of the most demanded, although it can be any procedure or consultation. This type of tourism has been one of the most criticized worldwide, mainly because the reasons that move the tourist are very varied and range from economic reasons, in some places it is cheaper than in others, or for reasons of legality. In some cases, the national government itself is in charge of promoting and developing health tourism, as in the case of Turkey where, thanks to various subsidies and agreements, hair implant surgeries are cheaper than in other countries. 

 

Cultural tourism.

 

In cultural tourism, the tourist wishes to know all the cultural aspects related to a country of interest, which includes, in most cases, its history, art and gastronomy. This type of tourism brings great benefits to the sector as it attracts travelers at all times of the year and promotes the development of the destination's local identity. Among the main activities sought by travelers are visits to museums, attendance to festivals or tasting of local gastronomy; it also includes more intimate celebrations of the locality or even language learning.

 

Gastronomic tourism.

 

Gastronomic tourism is part of cultural tourism, however, in this case, the tourist only seeks to taste the local gastronomy and not to explore other cultural areas. Gastronomic activities include tasting as many dishes and drinks as possible and experiencing all the culinary activities linked to them. Similarly, many destinations have gastronomic routes or culinary festivals scheduled at different times of the year. These events mobilize many tourists and generate an important economic impact in the area. Add also that the gastronomic experience will be as deep as the traveler desires, ranging from visits to restaurants to personal cooking classes given by the local population.

 

Wellness tourism.

 

Wellness tourism is a direct branch of health tourism that aims to achieve physical, psychological and spiritual well-being. For this reason, tourists choose destinations where activities related to each area are carried out, such as yoga, meditation or spiritual retreats. This type of tourism is becoming more popular as the concept of mindfulness spreads and as society becomes more aware of the importance of preserving health. The latter is what differentiates it from health tourism, which seeks to restore health once it has been lost. Among the preferred destinations for wellness tourism are: India, Spain, Singapore, Malaysia, California, Bali, Italy and Hawaii.

pill.title: Mega trends in tourism and business opportunities
pill.content:
Educational tourism.

 

In educational tourism, the tourist travels to learn within an academic environment. Therefore, this type of tourism includes exchange trips, summer courses or guided visits to laboratories or institutions. The activity within this sector has become increasingly diversified as international cooperation ties in education are fostered. Tourists, mainly students, are often invited to take part in educational tourism in order to learn about their learning options in a country other than their country of residence.

 

Sports tourism.

 

Sport can be experienced in two ways, as a fan or as an athlete, and sports tourism involves both. The main reason that moves this type of tourist is the celebration of sporting events beyond the borders of the country where he/she resides; among the most popular are: soccer world cups, major baseball or basketball leagues and the Olympics. These types of events generally give rise to venues and infrastructure that contribute to local tourism and continue to attract more tourists in the future, as is the case of stadiums such as the Santiago Bernabeu, which in 20 years has attracted more than 15 million visitors.

 

In short, giving an answer to tourism trends is complex, especially because there are as many types of tourism as there are tourists' tastes; the main difference is that some become so popular that they become a trend. What makes one type of tourism more popular than another? Well, it is a multifactorial matter, in which the continuous renovation of the sector makes it always suitable to receive tourists of all generations.

 

Every year new ways and forms of tourism are added to the list. However, the aim is always the same: to satisfy the expectations and desires of the traveler, whatever they may be. In this sense, the sector faces a great challenge: to promote the creation of new tourist destinations, strengthen those that are doing well and renew those that have become obsolete; all in a race against the clock to attract the greatest number of travelers and become a trend for the coming seasons.

pill.title: Success stories in Casanare
pill.content:
Plains Safari.

 

El Encanto de Guanapalo.

 

It is a natural reserve in Casanare with rural lodging, with almost 9 thousand hectares of extension 110 km from Yopal, formed by the family legacy of grandfather Gerardo Zambrano in 3 typical herds of the region, which since 1908 have been working to preserve the natural wealth, tradition and culture of the llanera in Casanare Colombia.

 

Today, Hato Mata de Palma, Hato Altamira and Hato Montana make up El Encanto de Guanapalo, and they are united by the purpose of continuing to care for the environment and the llanera culture in Casanare through nature tourism and family work in the beautiful flooded savannas and gallery forests of the eastern plains of Colombia, In San Luis de Palenque, Casanare, where you can stay in comfortable rooms, enjoy typical llanero food and live experiences of adventure and tradition that you will never forget, such as the Llanero Safari.

pill.title: Success stories in Casanare
pill.content:
The Llanero Safari is offered on horseback, tractor or 4×4, it offers the opportunity for visitors to tour the vastness of the savannah contemplating wildlife and unique landscapes where you can see animals in their natural environment such as: Chigüiros, deer, babillas, wild horses, palm and honey bears, corocoras (herons), iguanas, ducks, howler monkeys, cattle, owls, armadillos, foxes, morrocoys (turtles), wild marranos, pumas, hundreds of bird species and many more.

 

This plan is ideal for a family trip or with friends who love nature in its purest state. Also during the trip you can observe the magical Garcero where the herons lay their eggs. 

 

The tour can end in a strategic place to see the llanero sunset, depending on weather conditions. 

 

The Safari has:

  • 15 mammal records.
  • Visit to HotSpots for bird and wildlife watching.
  • Duration of approximately 5 hours.
  • Activity accompanied by a certified guide.

pill.title: Success stories in Casanare
pill.content: Sightings on safari:

pill.title: Success stories in Casanare
pill.content:
Alta Gracia Nature Reserves (Cunaguaro travel).

 

The Llanero safari is the best opportunity to observe wildlife in freedom in Colombia.

 

It is a unique adventure where you will be able to observe large mammals and reptiles, as well as a great diversity of birds. In addition, you will be able to participate and contribute to conservation programs for the sustainability of these places.

 

We have our BIG-5 or Big 5: Otters, Jaguars, Anacondas, Capybaras and Anteaters, among many other species typical of this region.

pill.title: Success stories in Casanare
pill.content:
Hato Bonaire Natural Reserve.

 

If what you want is to live a day of authentic experiences of the work, culture and daily life of the "llanero", in total disconnection and contact with nature, enjoying the beautiful landscapes, sighting of flora and fauna in their natural habitat, this is the ideal place.

 

The experience in the Bonaire Natural Reserve Herd is done with the accompaniment of a local guide, aboard a buggy, truck or tractor (depending on the number of people) in which you will travel for three hours, the vast savannahs of the herd, to have the opportunity to see different species of wildlife including: white-tailed deer, chiguiros, howler monkeys, gabanes, herons, corocoras, road ducks, babillas, anteaters, guios, as well as a variety of native flora and the beautiful landscapes of the llanero sunset.

pill.title: Success stories in Casanare
pill.content:
MECA of tourism. 

 

MECA for tourism is a tourism initiative between the departments of Meta and Casanare, which seeks to strengthen the tourism production chain in these two regions.

 

The MECA Initiative brings together important entities and institutions of the departments of Meta and Casanare, such as the Chamber of Commerce, Fenalco, Cotelco, business leaders and entrepreneurs of the sector, in order to join efforts to strengthen tourism, promoting the different tourist routes that exist in these departments, thus developing a value strategy that provides alternatives to the current crisis experienced by the poor condition of the road to the plains.

 

Finally, MECA intends to create complementary products between the two departments, further promote the different existing activities and reduce illegal tourism in the region.

pill.title: Gastronomic entrepreneurship in Colombia
pill.content:
Gastronomy is an industry that is in the top 5 industries for entrepreneurs. And while it is an excellent option for entrepreneurship, it must be taken into account that these ventures require an adequate number of responsible, competent and, above all, clean personnel.

 

In addition to the personnel, there are other factors that, if fulfilled, make the business go ahead and achieve the break-even point.

 

Factors to take into account for a gastronomic business.

 

The business idea.

 

This is an indispensable element when starting a gastronomic business. It is important to start from the concept and define well what you want to achieve. Generally the most basic points to be determined are the type of restaurant and the target public.

 

Market research. 

 

Market research and analysis will surely give a more accurate answer as to where to aim. If the idea is to set up a small business, an opinion survey can be carried out among the target public, but if the venture is larger, a more careful and precise analysis is always recommended, at a professional level.

 

The location. 

 

This point refers to defining the strategic location of the venture. In order to determine the best location, the fixed costs represented by the place and how they affect the general budget must also be taken into account. In addition, other aspects should also be considered when choosing the location, such as traffic frequency, if it is an office area, if there is parking space, if there is too much competition, etc.  

 

Menu development.

 

The menu is the basis of the gastronomic business because it defines its differential factor before the competition and encompasses the general concept of the business. Regardless of the size of the enterprise, the key to success lies in knowing how to choose the right and adequate menu for the target public.

 

Cost structure. 

 

This is another important point to take into account when starting a gastronomic business. In addition to analyzing the investment figure and the cash flow, a balance must be established between the amounts invested and spent to obtain profits.

pill.title: Mega gastronomy trends and business opportunities
pill.content:
Increase in home delivery.

 

Delivery applications represent an alternative for users to consume without leaving their homes, being a means of easy access, price and variety. This trend will continue to grow, thanks to the increase in relations between companies and individuals through technological advances, to have products or services available at any time of the day.

 

Proof of this has been the 60% increase in requests from users of platforms such as Domicilios.com by 2020. This shows that society continues to change routines and lifestyles, and will be a feature that will remain.

 

Restaurant at home.

 

With social isolation measures people have changed the habit of going to a restaurant and replacing it with preparing or ordering food to the home. Both delivery apps and restaurants have brought out different digital and culinary options.

 

Users, for their part, have experimented at home and now vacuum-packed ingredients, frozen meats and various recipes will continue to be an option for diners.

 

Contactless payment.

 

As a measure to avoid catching the virus, people have opted to have online and contactless payment methods in order to keep their distance.

 

This behavior has been reflected in the 70% increase in credit card payments from allies such as Bancolombia, Scotiabank Colpatria, Davivienda, Banco de Bogotá and AV Villas, as it is a means of payment that generates trust and security. The new normality proposes to discourage the use of cash, to the extent that people feel safer making their payments.

 

Innovative hamburgers.

 

The hamburger, which was the most ordered dish in 2020 through home delivery, will continue to gain market share due to its practicality, ease and multiplicity of options to offer.  As a result, establishments in this category will need to use innovation in their recipes to win consumer preference.

 

Support for local enterprises.

 

The situation we have lived through, besides affecting the lifestyle we used to lead, has also meant a hard blow to the country's economy and to short-lived entrepreneurs. As a result, people and companies have realized that, by supporting local enterprises and businesses, they are contributing to the growth of the economy and the creation of new jobs.

 

A culture of cooperativism will continue to be promoted to foster income alternatives and take advantage of technology to create new opportunities.

pill.title: Mega gastronomy trends and business opportunities
pill.content:
Plant-based products: The canvas for innovation.

 

As personal health and global sustainability have proven to be strong drivers of consumer choice, plant-based product innovation and development has shifted from mimicking meat, fish and dairy products to optimizing choices that stand on their own merits. When asked what reasons consumers have for considering plant-based alternatives, they tell us they consider them healthier and better for the planet. A third reason, the desire for dietary variation, is further driving interest in plant-based beyond the traditional vegan and vegetarian sectors.

 

In the last year there has been a 59%* increase in new plant-based products that also carry a premium or indulgence claim. This is another indication that, from convenience food to gastronomy, people are looking for the quality alternatives that plant-based products can offer.

 

Gut care.

 

A report revealed that consumers are now looking for foods that are geared toward improving their personal health and well-being. Respondents said that aspects of health such as immunity, energy levels, good sleep and mood are directly related to good gut health. On the other hand, 67% of respondents stated that gut health is key to achieving overall wellness. Therefore, products that include fiber or probiotics will increase in demand as they continue to offer health benefits to consumers.

 

Back to the roots

 

In the wake of the pandemic, shoppers increasingly value the functionality, freshness and authenticity of local foods. A growing habit among consumers is to look for companies that guarantee a positive impact on the community, as well as freshness and naturalness. The majority of people who had purchased locally sourced products said they would do so again in the coming year. Among these products, the attributes that most stand out are their freshness, flavor and nutritional benefits.

 

Broaden experiences.

 

According to Lu Ann Williams, director of Insights and Innovation at Innova Market Insights, the pandemic also accelerated consumers' desire for new challenges and experiences. More than 50% of respondents said that, post-Covid-19, they want to be more adventurous with their food and beverage choices. 

 

The report also revealed that consumers want to see more strategic partnerships in order to create new flavors, textures or to innovate in presentation formats. However, a sector of respondents noted that this desire to explore new horizons is only possible with familiar and trusted brands.

 

Recycling redefined. 

 

Creating food from waste is positioning itself as a great circular economy option. Ingredients that were once considered waste now have a new life in the circular economy and consumers identify with this trend. 35% of people responded that products containing recycled ingredients are more appealing than others. Attributes such as sustainability, health and nutrition and freshness are what the public rescues most from this type of products. More than 255 products are seeking to receive the new Upcycled Food Association seal, which will be the first brand in the world to certify foods with recycled ingredients.

pill.title: Success stories in Casanare
pill.content:
Llaneridad gourmet.

 

Company created in Yopal that transforms and commercializes food products that are part of the llanero kitchenware, without the addition of preservatives or chemical additives. 

 

They rescue the llanera culture with artisanal food production, evoking the cuisine of the grandparents of the plains of Casanare, and support enterprises to promote their finished products.

pill.title: Curiosities
pill.content:
Did you know...

 

The Colombian restaurant Leo was ranked as the 46th best in the world, according to the list 'World's 50 Best Restaurants', this restaurant offers a journey through the biocultural richness of the Colombian biomes.

 

Chef Leonor Espinosa has based her culinary project on rescuing the value of traditional products and ways of cooking in different communities in the country and looking for ways that this valuable knowledge can contribute to a better quality of life for the people.

posts.title: The alligator toom
posts.description: It tells the story of the caiman toom, an old and gigantic specimen that protects its eggs day and night from the terrible human claws, so that they can know the wonderful life that the tributary of the Orinoco offers them.

posts.title: Capybara mama and the plains drought
posts.description: During the year, mother capybara and her children enjoy their life in the vicinity of the Pauto river, but the long arm of pollution and destruction has reached their home, now they must flee and find a new home for their children, lives the story of Capybara mom, our heroine.

posts.title: Lola, the drama of a mother
posts.description: Lola, the otter and her children are threatened when a group of animal traffickers arrives on the river bank, who, upon realizing the presence of the otters, see the possibility of selling them to earn money.

posts.title: The aardvark super hero
posts.description: "Samy" is a very outgoing anteater who lives happily with his mother but he wants to find new friends so he can have fun in the pond, but this fun is obstructed by the problems that his species and its habitat live due to the evil actions of man. and the monster "petroleum".

posts.title: What are we mom?
posts.description: Faced with the disturbing question of her children, the woolly chucha responds and argues about the identity of their species and the importance they are for the ecosystem.

posts.title: Forest olympics
posts.description: The story takes place in the forest where all the tapirs once a year met to do their diving competitions and decide who was the best, the winner gave them various seeds to eat and plant and thus counteract the felling of trees.

posts.title: Branches of the trade
posts.description: Yaki is one of the few night monkeys whose family is still complete and reunited; despite the stalking scientists and the continuous fighting between legal and illegal armed groups.

posts.title: Man stains
posts.description: Othello seems to be used to eating the animals of a nearby farm, the owner although annoying, limits himself to scare him away, but a hunter offers to get rid of the 'problem' at no cost, in the end due to the circumstances the farmer recognizes that it is not the fault of the animal, but of those who invade their environment.

posts.title: No hunting, like at home
posts.description: Kata is a lonely limpet and with traumas of course abandonment, she was too young to understand the circumstances in which her parents died at the hands of hunters, escaping from one of them she finds her partner and with whom they will persevere so as not to let her your species is eradicated.

posts.title: Slow leak, quick conclusion
posts.description: We have Roko on the scene, a male long-nosed turtle whose hobby is ... letting time go by. In one of his routines he is found by a group of indigenous people who capture him and reunite with others of the same species. One of them warns him about his destiny: to be merchandise or food.

posts.title: Harmful protection
posts.description: Totema is a cunning, persistent and brave turtle, but that will not reach him until he realizes that his fight has an end.

posts.title: Grandma Goose
posts.description: "Every day an old goose sees how her environment changes, and the poor little geese have to adapt to the changes that damage their ecosystem and their way of life, read the stories of Leonor the older goose."

posts.title: Free of flown
posts.description: Xalma is caged in a truck about to be sold. From her confinement, she tells us her story without suspecting that she will have a positive outcome, although only for her.

posts.title: What we parrots talk about
posts.description: It tells how an obese parrot got to this condition due to the irresponsible care of human beings. A contradictory way to conserve the species, as deforestation has led these creatures to reduce their numbers.

posts.title: On someone else's skin
posts.description: Tasko is a pollero wolf, a lizard with a great appetite and a confident character. Initially, he is stressed at the thought that he was abandoned by his family, but he will discover thanks to an old friendship that his children did not leave voluntarily, but instead became articles of clothing and fashion accessories for unconcerned people.

posts.title: Teacher Pepperan
posts.description: "In each school day the teacher Pepperan teleported his students to times ago with his great and funny stories"

posts.title: Path of roses, glorious birds
posts.description: It is not enough for this striking specimen called Rozz to stand out, however, of its striking plumage and advantage to find food thanks to its spoon / spatula-shaped beak. but the wild life is raw and he must take it on with his characteristic good attitude.

posts.title: Robbed thief, and his world ended
posts.description: The soldier garzon is a huge bird whose reputation as a predator is well known among those who have been the victims of its attacks. Iguaro will now discover that while he was stealing prey, he and all the birds were stealing their trees.

posts.title: Until it's over
posts.description: A group of deer that feed are ambushed by hunters who set fire to the area to confuse them, in the flight the youngest fall into the hands of men, which forces Azel to return, the young men manage to flee, but Azel stays in his replacement.

posts.title: Red-hot celebration
posts.description: Ibis is an ordinary corocora, but it knows well what is good for it. When he realizes the evil that humans cause, he decides to simply leave, forming part of the migration statistics that report the red ibis as displaced from its habitat.

posts.title: Before and after, here was a fish
posts.description: There are no protagonists here, but there are antagonists depending on the point of view. The payara is feared for its ferocity and voracious appetite, but who the real monster is will soon be revealed. Man is killing this species due to overfishing.

posts.title: Healthy prj mavera
posts.description: On this occasion we will be guided by animals that interact with plants. Cayenne is a plant whose flower serves multiple health benefits.

posts.title: Fruit of exploitation
posts.description: Some travelers (known as backpackers) get lost in the jungles of the Orinoco and decide to use nearby palms to guarantee survival. In an exaggerated way for narrative sake, they build all kinds of items and prepare some foods. Finally the reflection aims to be responsible and respectful with the use of this plant.

posts.title: Oranges in the air
posts.description: There is nothing to worry about, the palo de cruz tree proliferates and its abundance benefits its environment. Polena will limit herself to discovering one of the most remarkable aspects of this species: its reproductive phase, at the end it will throw some pistils into the air inviting them to enjoy this flower.

posts.title: Wood in sunset
posts.description: A sad beginning, a knot that does not improve and an ending that gives hope. Logging kills the trees.

posts.title: Go up like palm ... and there it stays
posts.description: Here there will only be good omen, abundance and well-being. The corozo palm is a stable species and under good care.

posts.description: A plant whose flower pollen does not like? This seems to be the case, since it is a sporiferous plant. But is she bad enough to talk about her?
